season.name: Winter
advantages: Lower pest and disease pressure in some regions.
disadvantages: Reduced nutrient absorption at lower temperatures.
tips: Continue irrigation at night.
Apply water-soluble fertilizers through drip every fourth day (fertigation).
Provide essential nutrients like N, P, K, Mg, Ca, S, Zn, Fe, and B.

corrective.whenTooHigh: Provide shade, use crop covers, irrigate frequently.
corrective.whenTooLow: Irrigate at night, use windbreaks, consider greenhouse or row covers.

tips: Monitor temperature, especially during critical growth stages.

rootInformation: Relatively shallow rooting depth (typically less than 1 meter).

corrective.whenTooHigh: Shade netting, evaporative cooling, increased irrigation.

tips: Use weather data to anticipate temperature fluctuations; adjust irrigation and shading accordingly.

corrective.whenTooHigh: Improve ventilation; apply fungicides as needed.
corrective.whenTooLow: Misting systems; increase irrigation frequency; use humidifiers.

avoid: Stagnant air; prolonged periods of high humidity promoting fungal growth.
tips: Monitor humidity levels; ensure adequate air circulation to prevent disease.

soil.name: Well-drained loamy soil

tips: Test soil pH regularly; adjust amendments based on soil test results.

nutrientProfile.name: Nitrogen
avoid: Nitrogen deficiency (yellowing leaves); excessive nitrogen leading to lush growth but poor fruit production.

corrective.whenTooHigh: Reduce nitrogen fertilizer application; increase irrigation to leach excess nitrogen.
corrective.whenTooLow: Apply nitrogen-rich fertilizer (e.g., urea, ammonium sulfate).

tips: Monitor leaf color and growth rate; adjust nitrogen application accordingly.

nutrientProfile.name: Phosphorus
avoid: Phosphorus deficiency (stunted growth, purplish leaves); phosphorus toxicity (rare, but can interfere with micronutrient uptake).

corrective.whenTooHigh: Reduce phosphorus fertilizer; improve soil drainage.
corrective.whenTooLow: Apply phosphorus fertilizer (e.g., superphosphate, rock phosphate).

tips: Ensure adequate phosphorus availability, especially during early growth stages.

nutrientProfile.name: Potassium
avoid: Potassium deficiency (leaf edge yellowing, poor fruit filling); potassium toxicity (can interfere with magnesium uptake).

corrective.whenTooHigh: Reduce potassium fertilizer; leach soil with water.
corrective.whenTooLow: Apply potassium fertilizer (e.g., potassium sulfate, potassium chloride).

tips: Potassium is crucial for fruit quality; monitor potassium levels throughout the growing season.
Conduct regular soil tests to monitor nutrient levels and pH; amend soil as needed.

corrective.whenTooHigh: Establish windbreaks (e.g., trees, fences); provide support for plants.
corrective.whenTooLow: Increase air circulation with fans if disease pressure increases.

avoid: Strong winds that can damage leaves and topple plants, especially during flowering and fruit set.
tips: Plant windbreaks perpendicular to prevailing winds; ensure proper plant spacing to minimize wind damage.
